meanings.definition: A coarse plaster used to cover exterior walls.
meanings.sent1: The old house had roughcast on its walls to protect them from the weather.
meanings.sent2: The builder applied roughcast to the outside of the building to give it a textured finish.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids drew smiley faces on the roughcast of the school walls.
meanings.sent4: The roughcast on the walls of the castle resembled the rugged surface of a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The roughcast on the walls felt rough to the touch, like sandpaper.

meanings.sent1: The workers roughcasted the entire facade of the building to give it a traditional look.
meanings.sent2: She decided to roughcast the garden wall to match the rustic style of her home.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully roughcasted the cake with icing, creating a unique texture.
meanings.sent4: His words roughcasted a shadow of doubt in her mind about the project's success.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes roughcasted the canvas with bold colors and textures.
